rComments: Teaches catchphrases like "write business casual" and gives assignments that aren't conducive to improving writing skills (e.g. five quick sentences in response to a Buzzfeed News article, group essay project with no clear rubric or expectations). His feedback is rude and unconstructive. He obfuscates the arguments of those who disagree with him.
Sergi is overly theatrical and vague. For a writing course, very little writing is assigned and only in the form of strange assignments. Overall, I would not recommend.

You learn more useless catchphrases than writing skills. There is a group essay for each tutorial (for which there is little accountability, so you may end up doing the entire thing yourself). Overall, this course felt extremely unprofessional and useless.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Group projects', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Sergi is unclear and is more concerned with impressing students than actually teaching. Lectures are brutal. The entire class is geared towards each tutorial group doing a GROUP paper. It was a disaster and no one became a better writer for taking this class. Do not take this class if you have accessibility issues- the attendance policy is a joke.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Group projects', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Sergi is passionate about his subject (drama) without a doubt, and you can tell he tries his best. Unfortunately, I found his interpretations unrefined, and that he commits more to dazzling students than producing genuine insights. I know this sounds condescending, but he was unable to answer my questions a number of times. A+ just by writing well.
For this class specifically, the academic reading was pretty heavy. Very engaging professor, office hours were usually crowded, but he tries his best to help you.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Sergi is one of the *best* teachers I've ever had. If you are passionate about learning and wish to improve your writing skills, take his class. Not only does he encourage his students to engage with readings and with one another, but he is often there to help and offer guidance, especially to less experienced students. He's also very funny!

extremely intelligent professor & his courses are very thought-provoking; very caring but his office hour is always busy (many students come to ask questions); one small quiz every course (very basic questions to test whether you've read the assigned reading materials); high expectations but very willing to help. Highly recommended!

Matt is a funny, caring, engaging guy. As a prof, he has high expectations and tough standards - pushes you to the point of anxiety. Willing to help, but office hours are way too busy. Assigns too many readings and you don't get to discuss all of them. Very expensive textbooks. He lets his students run the lectures, but this can be disorganizing.

I always looked forward to attending this class. It made me a better student. It taught me not only to absorb information but to question until I understood, and then to share my thoughts. During lectures, I learned a great deal from other students, too. Professor Sergi truly cares about what he's teaching and makes the time to help his students.

Fantastic teacher with incredible presence as a lecturer. Takes student contributions seriously and is more available for out-of-class discussion than any prof I've had. Puts huge effort into his innovative teaching methods. Made medieval drama fun and relevant, made us far better critical thinkers and writers. I'd recommend his classes to anyone.

Professor Sergi is the best prof I've had. I took a class in summer and he made 3 hour lectures enjoyable. He comes off as intense but it's because he's genuinely passionate about what he's teaching. If you put effort in and come to class it's not hard to do well. I talked to him a couple times about essays and he was more than helpful.
Prof Sergi is very engaged with students and interested in actually teaching.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: He exemplifies what the university experience should be. He treats students as people who can achieve things rather than just absorb things. He is a fair marker but you'll have to put in the time to get good grades. (he'll be there for you every step of the way for help) Plus he is enthusiastic &  hot, just try not to get lost in his tangents.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Professor Sergi was an amazing prof. He constantly aimed to get us out of our tendency to infantalize ourselves around professors. He talked to us like we were all on the same level. His classes were interesting (and let me tell you pre-1600 literature was not something I was looking forward to). He is hilarious and easy-going.  READING IS A MUST!
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Professor Sergi can be helpful, but he's so easy to approach that there's often a line-up to his office. He helps people who try for sure. In class he's actually very fun and entertaining. Not too organized but overall it comes together. What I liked most is that he encouraged everyone to work TOGETHER as a group rather than be competitive

K Matt is the best prof ever. Besides being ben affleck's look alike and incredibly funny he loves what he teaches & that = students learning. He is extremely helpful & WILL NOT let you fail so long as u are willing to work. He will get u the coveted UofT A, just show u care about ur education & his class. You'd be a fool not to take his class

Paul Rudd's good looks and quick wit mixed with the charisma of a master lecturer. This guy is awesome. He is enthusiastic and approachable and hilarious. I would highly recommend taking his classes. For the most part I found that his marking was quite fair except for one assignment. I forgive him though.

The material is interesting but this class was really difficult. Sergi may be appear to be a cool professor in the first few classes but don't let that fool you. His expectations and instructions are so unclear I don't think he knows what he wants half the time. I honestly thought my final grade was arbitrarily given.
